member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.ResponseSubmittedEventArgs
member.summary:
Provides data for the event.
New in v1.3
member.remarks: The event occurs when the message balloon is dismissed by user input. You can use the Response property to ascertain values entered into an HTML form in the message balloon or to determine the name of a button or link clicked by the user.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.ResponseSubmittedEventArgs.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.ResponseSubmittedEventArgs.Response
member.summary: Gets a string containing the name of a selected link or button or the results of a form embedded in the text of the message balloon.
member.remarks:
The following table describes possible values for this property and the HTML elements that can create them. ElementHTML exampleResponse value Name of a linkHelphelplink Name of a buttonOKbutton HTML form results
action=notify Note that using cmd:#, where # is an integer, as the name for a HTML element prevents the event from being raised. The cmd:2 identifier performs a special purpose: it displays the notification icon in the title bar making it suitable for Cancel buttons.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.ResponseSubmittedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

Controls vibration on the device.
Revised in v1.3
member.remarks: Supported only on Smartphone. Previously named OpenNETCF.Notification.Vibrate. Vibration equipped Pocket PC devices emulate the Vibration motorl as a notification Led.

member.summary: Plays the default looping vibration on the device.
member.returns: TRUE if vibration started successfully else FALSE.

platform.os: Pocket PC Phone Edition, Windows Mobile 2003 for Smartphone

platform.os: Pocket PC Phone Edition, Windows Mobile 2003 for Smartphone

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Vibrate.GetDeviceCaps(OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Vibrate.VibrationCapabilities)
member.summary: Gets the current device vibration capabilities.
member.param: Member of the VibrationCapabilities enumeration identifying what capability to query.
member.returns: 0 if the capability is not supported, 1 if a single level is supported or a value between 2 and 7 if multiple levels are supported.
member.remarks: This function returns the number of vibration steps (a number from 0 to 7) that the device hardware supports for the requested vibration capability.

platform.os: Pocket PC Phone Edition, Windows Mobile 2003 for Smartphone

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Vibrate.VibrationCapabilities
member.summary:
Used by the GetDeviceCaps function to query the device vibration capabilities.
New in v1.1

platform.os: Pocket PC Phone Edition, Windows Mobile 2003 for Smartphone

member.summary: Query the frequency that the device supports.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification
member.summary:
Implements Windows CE functionality for displaying and responding to user notifications.
New in v1.3
member.remarks:
This class provides a managed implementation of the Windows CE notification functions. This class is supported only on the Pocket PC.
You can create notifications and then display them as needed using the property. The property sets the time the message balloon initially displays. If you set to zero and Visible to true, the message balloon does not appear but its icon is available in the title bar for reactivation when clicked. The event occurs whenever the balloon is shown or hidden, either programmatically using the property or through user interaction. In addition to plain text, you can create a user notification with HTML content in the message balloon. The HTML is rendered by the Pocket PC HTML control, and you can respond to values in an HTML form by parsing a response string provided by the class, through the property. Cmd:2 Identifier
The identifier "cmd:2" has a special purpose in Windows CE and is used to dismiss notifications. If cmd:2 is the name of an HTML button or other element in a message balloon, the event is not raised. The notification is dismissed, but its icon is placed on the title bar to be responded to at a later time.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This class is not supported on the Smartphone or other Windows CE devices that are not Pocket PCs. You can create multiple notifications, such as an array of notifications, and display them as needed with the Visible property.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.Caption
member.summary: Gets or sets a string specifying the title text for the message balloon.
member.value: A string that specifies the caption text. The default value is an empty string ("").
member.remarks: The background color of the caption is dependent on the current theme of the user. Use the property to modify the text in the body of the message balloon.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.Critical
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the notification is of urgent importance.
member.value: true if the notification is critical; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.remarks: Critical notifications have a red background caption color, or other color, depending on the current Pocket PC theme.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.IconHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets the current native icon handle for the message balloon on the title bar.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.InitialDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds the message balloon remains visible after initially shown.
member.remarks: The amount of time the balloon is visible, in seconds. The default is 10.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text for the message balloon.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the message balloon is visible.

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.BalloonChanged
member.summary: Occurs when a message balloon is displayed or hidden.

member.name: E:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.Notification.ResponseSubmitted
member.summary: Occurs when the user clicks a button or link in the message balloon.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMode
member.summary:
Specifies the input modes that can be set on the Smartphone using an .
New in v1.3

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMode.AlphaABC
member.summary: This is the conventional method for entering text, called multi-tap, which requires up to four key presses depending on the letter being entered.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMode.AlphaCurrent
member.summary:
Maintains the current T9 or ABC selection for entering alpha characters as set by the user by holding down the star key (*) on a Smartphone. This mode is shared across the system so that any text box set with this mode, including text box controls in native Windows CE applications, will adhere to the last T9 or ABC choice as set by the user. This ability to match user preferences makes this the preferred input mode for text boxes that accept alpha characters.
Note that if the user selects a numeric input mode (123) with the star key for a text box set to AlphaCurrent, the text box will only accept numeric characters but will be set to the current alpha input mode (T9 or ABC) when the text box loses and regains focus.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMode.AlphaT9
member.summary: This input mode is the T9 predictive text input feature on the Smartphone.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.WindowsCE.Forms.InputMode.Numeric
member.summary: This input mode accepts only numeric characters and symbols.
